lesson1.title: A blockchain is a decentralized digital ledger that records transactions across many computers in such a way that the registered transactions cannot be altered retroactively. Each block in the chain contains multiple transactions, and every time a new transaction occurs on the blockchain, a record of that transaction is added to every participant's ledger. This ensures transparency and security, as the data is distributed and verified across multiple nodes, making it difficult for any single entity to manipulate the information.
lesson1.task: Assemble building blocks (transactions) into a chain
lesson1.learningOutcome: A blockchain is an immutable digital ledger that is collectively verified by all participants.

lesson2.title: Understanding Stellar
lesson2.goal: Know the difference from other blockchains.
lesson2.task: Send token to friend (simulation) and view speed.
lesson2.learningOutcome: Stellar is fast, cheap, and without mining.

lesson3.title: Public & Privacy
lesson3.task: View public transaction and guess if the sender is known
lesson3.learningOutcome: Everything is visible, but no one knows the real name.

lesson4.title: Your account
lesson4.goal: Understand the structure and significance of public/private keys.
lesson4.task: Matching Game: What is Public, What is Secret
lesson4.learningOutcome: Only the secret key provides access; the public key may be shared.

lesson5.title: Send & Receive
lesson5.goal: Understanding the functionality of transactions and trustlines
lesson5.task: Execute test shipment and view fee
lesson5.learningOutcome: Each transaction incurs a small fee; Trustline = permission to receive.

lesson6.title: Token & Trading
lesson6.task: Place a token on a virtual marketplace and monitor the price change.
lesson6.learningOutcome: Price is determined by supply and demand.

lesson7.title: Security
lesson7.task: Sorting correct/incorrect actions; detecting fake tokens
lesson7.learningOutcome: Confidentiality of the key, secure storage, and use of the testnet.

lesson8.title: Verification & Identity
lesson8.learningOutcome: KYC = Identity verification, verification shows trustworthy tokens.

lesson9.title: Zero Knowledge
lesson9.task: Example scenario 'I am over 18' without displaying a birth date.
lesson9.learningOutcome: It is possible to prove something without revealing secrets.

lesson10.title: Practice with SKM
lesson10.task: Create an account in the testnet, activate it, set a trustline, send tokens.
lesson10.learningOutcome: Understand the technical processes of a transaction.

lesson11.title: Responsibility
lesson11.task: Decision Game: Act Correctly or Not
lesson11.learningOutcome: Blockchain is final; due diligence is mandatory.

lesson12.title: Completion / Playful Learning
lesson12.learningOutcome: Review learned material, recognize your own progress.
